definition: Three contrasting approaches to memorization: (1) Little Porn's absolute correspondence - image/space for every word; (2) The Mnemonist's method - nature unclear; (3) Quonxy's purity approach - sounds/words for themselves.
notes: Comparison framework. Three distinct mnemonic traditions documented.

definition: W1 maps operate with only three cardinal directions. No East exists in standard Densworld cartography. Fundamental cosmological difference from external frameworks.
notes: Core cartographic constraint. East-absence not arbitrary but reflects W1 spatial structure.

definition: Practice of observing two-state (binary) mechanisms in nature. Two versions: Half Bad observes on/off present/absent states materialistically; Grit prays 'on the blink' and assigns ones/zeros spiritually.
notes: Dual tradition. Materialist and spiritual approaches to same binary observation.

definition: 'The form of a living thing that follows the witch after its death.' Post-mortem companion creatures associated with witch practitioners.
notes: Supernatural category. Not suitable for standard taxonomic classification.

definition: Cosmic events occurring every 30 million years. Nature and effects unclear.
notes: Term preserved but meaning degraded. Requires further research.

definition: Fire → kindling → fire cycle. Philosophical exploration of the relationship between consuming and fueling. Core W1 metaphysical concept.
notes: Foundational metaphysical framework. Connects to material cycle concepts.

definition: Exploration of interiority. Question: 'What if there were no such thing as the inner?' Connects to: Dens as pre-linguistic zone; Tower-desert as post-linguistic zone.
related_terms: Apocalypse of the Inner; Pre/Post-linguistic zones
notes: Consciousness studies. What happens when all thoughts become public.

definition: Various materials/substances of the Dens: Densmuck (the muck); Gritmuck (surface material); Densash (covers Yeller women); Densgrit (trap material); Densbone (traded); Densground ('the dens gives ground').
notes: Material taxonomy. Essential for Dens navigation and trade.

definition: Zone below Dens surface. The shelf under villages. Subterranean lake. Where creatures and dangers dwell. No surveyor returns from deep penetration.
notes: Unmappable zone. Principle of Selective Blindness applies. Data gaps intentional.

definition: Objects classified by number of possible states: 2-state through 12-state complexity. Higher N indicates greater behavioral complexity.
notes: Object classification framework. Relates to binary naturalism as special case (N=2).

definition: The boundary that transforms negation to freedom. Liminal concept about crossing thresholds. What happens at edges of classification.
notes: Boundary philosophy. Connects to Tross's work on edges and transitions.

definition: Division of W1 space by linguistic character: The Dens represents 'pre-linguistic' zone; Tower-desert represents 'post-linguistic' zone. Language itself has geography.
notes: Spatial-linguistic framework. Dens defies language; desert-tower operates through it.

definition: Methodological schism in creature taxonomy. Stone School emphasizes fixed classification; Water School (Renna Caw) emphasizes fluid boundaries and transformation.
notes: Taxonomic methodological debate. Parallels retrieval vs geometric math schism.

definition: Third position in taxonomic debate. Between Stone and Water schools. Emphasizes gradual change within stable categories.
notes: Minor school. Compromise position. Few adherents documented.

definition: Classification of trader trajectories: Lucky Fool (succeeds despite inexperience); Weathered Hand (experienced adapts); Doomed Optimist (fails despite effort); Happy Accident (succeeds unexpectedly).
notes: Venn's archetype proposal. Traders Guild skeptical. Counter-view: Meck Drune (anti-archetype).

definition: People who know they're being predicted. Key characteristic preventing prediction accuracy. Jackson as paradigmatic case.
related_terms: Identity as Performance; Student Success Modeling
notes: Prediction limitation. 'You cannot model freedom. You can only model compliance.'

definition: 'A number that restates what you already knew is not information.' Core skeptical principle about data interpretation and genuine discovery.
notes: Foundational skeptical principle. Widely cited in methodology debates.

definition: Birds connected to Yeller mythology. 'Little flock of five.' Associated saying: 'Yeller girl = missing child; yeller bloom = broken promise.'
notes: Folkloric creature. Connection to five-nature and Yeller entity unclear.
